subject: dictionary in lexical sets?
msgSnippet: While I am working on a QuikScript dictionary, I keep wanting a system that will represent phonemes rather than sounds. Is it possible to create a useful
messageBody:
While I am working on a QuikScript dictionary, I keep wanting a system
that will represent phonemes rather than sounds. Is it possible to
create a useful dictionary with lexical sets and letters?

dress dr-DRESS-s
trap trTRAPp
bath (AM) b-TRAP-Thin [where think represents a psuedo lexical set of /T/
bath (BR) b-PALM-Thin

Right now I am running across combinations of sounds which I don't know
how to transliterate. I think it would be better to have the words
represented as lexical sets, and later we can decide later what QS
letters to use to represent these lexical sets.

Paul

While I am working on a QuikScript dictionary, I keep wanting a system 
that will represent phonemes rather than sounds. Is it possible to 
create a useful dictionary with lexical sets and letters?

dress dr-DRESS-s
trap trTRAPp
bath (AM) b-TRAP-Thin [where think represents a psuedo lexical set of /T/
bath (BR) b-PALM-Thin

Right now I am running across combinations of sounds which I don't know 
how to transliterate. I think it would be better to have the words 
represented as lexical sets, and later we can decide later what QS 
letters to use to represent these lexical sets.

Paul
